content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an implementation of `extract_julia_code` function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = [x[2:end-1] for x in eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seperators=["\n"])]
    
    joined_code_blocks = join([strip(x, '\n') for x in code_blocks], "\n")
    
    return joined_code_blocks
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all code blocks in the markdown document. It then removes code fences (````julia\n and \n````) from each block, strips any leading or trailing newline characters and joins them together with a newline character.
